conbody.p: Depending on what your goal is, there are different approaches to querying the database. Some commands query based on a numeric ID, while others will filter. Queries also differ in the number of results they return: some lookups should return no more than one result, if the lookup key is unique.

Persistent therefore provides a few different query functions. As usually, we try to encode as many invariants in the types as possible. For example, a query that can return only 0 or 1 results will use a Maybe wrapper, whereas a query returning many results will return a list.
